snippet: With the minimum wage set to rise to £7.20 an hour in April, from £6.50, Prime Minister David Cameron said companies must conform or face fines.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron threatens companies with harsh fines if they do not pay a fair minimum wage; firms will have to pay at least 7.20 pounds an hour to employees age 26 or older starting in April 2016, and hourly rate will continue to rise through decade.
lead_paragraph: With the minimum wage set to rise to £7.20 an hour in April, from £6.50, Prime Minister David Cameron said companies must conform or face fines.

headline.main: British Employers Who Skirt ‘Living Wage’ Will Face Tough Fines, Cameron Says
headline.print_headline: British Employers Who Skirt ‘Living Wage’ Will Face Tough Penalties, Cameron Says
